messages: aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5 (17:22): can somebody tell me how firefox (10 on linux) determines applications to open file types or reads MIME database?
e587f6146ebfbdefdc028c591643f220 (17:24): aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5: I assumed it was using the open desktop stuff
e587f6146ebfbdefdc028c591643f220 (17:25): aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5: since when I register a mime for our game
aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5 (17:25): currently firefox does not know any file type from mime database, and i don't know what's missing
e587f6146ebfbdefdc028c591643f220 (17:25): hedgewars picks it up automatically
e587f6146ebfbdefdc028c591643f220 (17:25): firefox picks it up automatically
e587f6146ebfbdefdc028c591643f220 (17:26): ah. gnome specific stuff too
e587f6146ebfbdefdc028c591643f220 (17:26): I mean, we don't use it anymore, but good to know :)
67b8dbbd954f99b0be64bce6b421d195 (17:27): well this was probably written in 1999 ;-)
aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5 (17:28): khuey: thanks, but can you give me an abstraction how the initial application list is generated (mimetypes.rdf)
67b8dbbd954f99b0be64bce6b421d195 (17:31): and the rest gets added as the user downloads things, I think
67b8dbbd954f99b0be64bce6b421d195 (17:31): isn't that familiar with how this works
aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5 (17:34): khuey: whom could i ask about that, or where is it documented? there's no helpful in-depth documentation either at mozillazine or developer.mozilla.org
177f465fd068753b23e7e37e62c0d93b (17:36): most of the mappings come from the os
aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5 (17:36): 177f465fd068753b23e7e37e62c0d93b: ok, how is it queried?

aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5 (17:42): 177f465fd068753b23e7e37e62c0d93b: thanks for the information, should probably be documented at developer.mozilla.org as https://developer.mozilla.org/en/How_Mozilla_determines_MIME_Types#File_URIs is not really helpful
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (17:42): khuey, is it expected that DOMTimeStamp is a IDLWrapperType?
177f465fd068753b23e7e37e62c0d93b (17:43): darin, did you try clicking the link?
177f465fd068753b23e7e37e62c0d93b (17:44): aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5, did you try clicking the link?
177f465fd068753b23e7e37e62c0d93b (17:44): though that section is a bit outdated too

aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5 (17:45): 177f465fd068753b23e7e37e62c0d93b: the link you posted about the gnome registry was the important piece, which was not documented (i'm no coder, and/or i maybe was just to dumb to read the code properly :) )
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (17:46): wonders about using nsString off the main thread
177f465fd068753b23e7e37e62c0d93b (17:46): the gnome code is newer than when I wrote that documentation
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (17:47): is highly paranoid when threads are involved
aec0fec99583920d73df3f6d010641a5 (17:48): 177f465fd068753b23e7e37e62c0d93b: sure, probably because the switch happened just recently (on a wider scale)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (17:49): khuey, so an IDLWrapperType around an IDLTypedefType around an IDLBuiltinType?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (17:52): Indeed, which is why I asked
67b8dbbd954f99b0be64bce6b421d195 (17:52): forgot that TypedefTypes are separate from WrapperTypes
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (17:52): Also, the fact that DOMTimeStamp.type.isPrimitive() is False
67b8dbbd954f99b0be64bce6b421d195 (17:56): wonders if we should start tracking this all in bugzilla so I don't forget things
